title: Lyndon B Johnson National Historical Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations       Permits Driving Permits for the LBJ Ranch The LBJ Ranch tour is a self-guided, driving tour. All visitors planning to tour the Ranch must obtain a free driving permit. Request your permit at the LBJ State Park and Historic Site Visitor Center in Stonewall, Texas. You will also receive a map indicating the tour route.          Filming and Special Use Permits Commercial filming and photography permits are arranged on an individual basis, as are requests for any other special uses of the park. Contact the park for more information, 830-868-7128 ext. 260. You will find listed below copies of the permit applications. You may fill out these forms in Adobe Acrobat before printing them. Or, if you prefer, you may print the forms first and fill them in manually. Please type or print clearly if you choose to fill in the forms manually. 10-930 Special Park Use Application  10-931 Film Permit Application  SF-299 Application for Transportation and Utility Systems and Facilities on Federal Lands      Reservations Groups Reservations are required for groups (25 or more people) who want to tour the Boyhood Home or the Texas White House. Without a reservation, there is no guarantee that your large group will be able to take the tours, especially during the busy season—February through May, and especially during peak visitation periods—Thanksgiving week, Christmas holiday season, and spring break. Contact the park for more information, 830-868-7128 ext. 231.  Requests for special educational programs should also be directed to 830-868-7128 ext. 231.  Johnson City Event Center A rustic stone structure that may be reserved for private meetings and special events. Learn more...
